leukapp.apps.extractions.factories module¶

class ExtractionFactory[source]¶

Bases: factory.django.DjangoModelFactory

Creates Extraction object, mainly for testing purposes.

If no keyword argument is provided, ExtractionFactory will generate the appropriate attributes. See Extraction() for parameter details.

Warning

blabla

Parameters:
  • aliquot – Aliquot() object. If not provided, factory.SubFactory(AliquotFactory) will be used.
  • analyte – ANALYTE
  • platform – juan
  • technology – juan
  • center – juan
  • ext_id – juan
  • projects_list – juan
  • projects – juan
Returns:Extraction() object.

Creates Many to Many relationships to Project instances passed through the projects keyword argument. for example:

projects = [ProjectFactory() for i in range(3)]
extraction = ExtractionFactory(analyte=DNA, projects=projects)
Example::
extraction = ExtractionFactory(aliquot=AliquotFactory(), analyte=’DNA’)

See also

Extraction() Aliquot() AliquotFactory()

Note

blabla

blabla

Note

There are many other Info fields but they may be redundant:
  • param, parameter, arg, argument, key, keyword: Description of a parameter.
  • type: Type of a parameter.
  • raises, raise, except, exception: That (and when) a specific exception is raised.
  • var, ivar, cvar: Description of a variable.
  • returns, return: Description of the return value.
  • rtype: Return type.

Note

There are many other directives such as versionadded, versionchanged, rubric, centered, ... See the sphinx documentation for more details.

Creates Many to Many relationships to Project instances passed through the projects keyword argument. for example:

projects = [ProjectFactory() for i in range(3)]
extraction = ExtractionFactory(analyte=DNA, projects=projects)

ext_id = <factory.fuzzy.FuzzyText object>¶
platform = <factory.fuzzy.FuzzyChoice object>¶
projects = <factory.declarations.PostGeneration object>¶
projects_list = ''¶
technology = <factory.fuzzy.FuzzyChoice object>¶
